newsitem.title: FRANCE: PRESS DIGEST - France - Le Monde Oct 28.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - France - Le Monde Oct 28.

text.p: These are leading stories in afternoon daily Le Monde.
-- Prime Minister's office denies allegations by leader of outlawed Corsica separatist movement about secret talks in past between members of permier's office and Corsican separatists.
-- Businessman Vincent Bollore, who named Banque Rivaud chairman, sets out to refurbish its finances shaken by Air Liberte troubles.

-- One of Korean group Daewoo's leaders allegedly linked to corruption case, which may fuel further criticism over goverment plans to hand Thomson Multimedia to Daewoo for one symbolic franc as part of Lagardere 's offer for state-owned Thomson group.

-- Air France and its shareholders will study the possibility of buying AOM airline from a state structure selling off Credit Lyonnais assets, Air France chairman Christian Blanc said in an interview in regional newspaper Le Provencal.
-- Usinor Sacilor steel-maker may be interested in buying stake in state-owned Spanish competitor Corporacion Siderurgica.
